  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44774].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If the default reporter (with *Create Issues* permission) is set, then people who don't have a JIRA user account can create issues through email. Users in JIRA who don't have *Create Issues* permission can't create issues. The problem is, how is it that people who are not users are able to create issues however, JIRA users without *Create Issues* permission cannot at the least create issues as Default Reporter.

h3. Suggested Solution
If JIRA users don't have *Create Issues* permissions, then the issues are created as Default Reporter.
fields.summary: As a user without create user permission, I should be able to create issues as Default Reporter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44772].
  {panel}

The (experimental) JIRA REST api for issue properties has operations to:
* list all property names
* get the value of a single property
* delete a single property
* update/set a single property

What I really miss is the possibility to return *all properties including their values* in one single call in order to avoid the overhead of many single calls.
This possibility could also be resolved by adding another expand option "properties" to the search api via jql which will list all the properties including their values.
fields.summary: Property REST API improvements

fields.description:
h3. Summary
HTTPS WebHooks fail to alert remote applications when an issue has changed in JIRA.

This is likely caused caused by the fact that JIRA uses Third Party libraries that are affected by the issue in: [HTTPCORE-322|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCORE-322]. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Versions less than 6.4.0 that are using HTTPS WebHooks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Observe that External Applications are not receiving notifications
# Reviewing a Thread dump indicates threads on apache code:
# 
{code}
"httpclient-io:thread-7" #75 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0000000004c4e000 nid=0x9f3b runnable [0x00007f8e6503f000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.readNetRecord(SSLEngineImpl.java:829)
        - locked <0x00007f910aecc330> (a sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl)
        at sun.security.ssl.SSLEngineImpl.unwrap(SSLEngineImpl.java:781)
        - locked <0x00007f9320e8e9c8> (a java.lang.Object)
        at javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine.unwrap(SSLEngine.java:624)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.doUnwrap(SSLIOSession.java:228)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.decryptData(SSLIOSession.java:348)
        at org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession.isAppInputReady(SSLIOSession.java:371)
        - locked <0x00007f92abfaada0> (a org.apache.http.nio.reactor.ssl.SSLIOSession)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIODispatch.inputReady(AbstractIODispatch.java:118)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.readable(BaseIOReactor.java:160)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvent(AbstractIOReactor.java:342)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.processEvents(AbstractIOReactor.java:320)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractIOReactor.execute(AbstractIOReactor.java:280)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.BaseIOReactor.execute(BaseIOReactor.java:106)
        at org.apache.http.impl.nio.reactor.AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor$Worker.run(AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor.java:604)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

# Restarting the JIRA instance temporarily 'stops' this issue.

h3. Expected Results
When a Webhook is triggered, it is expected to publish a message over HTTPS. The debug logging in JIRA:
{code}
2015-08-12 23:31:40,968 pool-11-thread-2 DEBUG anonymous 982x3062x2 1ujddof 192.168.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl$PublishTaskImpl] Posting to web hook at https://<URL>...
{code}

h3. Actual Results
JIRA Debug logging reports the WebHook is posting a message
No network activity towards the External Service is observed.

h3. Notes
This behavior has not been reproduced by Atlassian.

h3. Workarounds
- Upgrade JIRA to JIRA 6.4.X version or higher where the version of {{httpcore-nio}} was increased to bumped to *4.3.2*
- Restart JIRA as a temporary measure.
fields.summary: Webhooks become non-responsive due to possible bug in atlassian-httpclient

h3. Summary 
The *Get Local Help* page does not wrap words in long lines correctly, nor provides horizontal scroll.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new resolution with a big description text. E.g.:
{code:none}
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Curabitur efficitur, mi at vulputate tincidunt, justo eros fringilla magna, vel blandit neque felis rhoncus libero. Etiam fermentum lacinia venenatis. Sed pellentesque tristique justo. Cras nec cursus est. Nunc bibendum nec libero at sodales. Maecenas varius nisl ut augue aliquam laoreet id ac enim. Donec commodo nibh a massa lacinia, non fermentum tellus pharetra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Nullam et lacinia ligula. Vivamus pellentesque eros mattis, vehicula massa id, semper justo. Maecenas laoreet aliquet ligula ut fringilla. Pellentesque faucibus, lacus eu mattis feugiat, ante nunc dignissim erat, ut volutpat erat nisl id purus. Integer et porta nisl. Nunc dignissim semper purus. Mauris sed turpis ipsum. In tempor, ipsum quis tempus aliquet, mi purus malesuada est, sed pharetra neque dui vel velit.
{code}
# Navigate to the *Create Issue* screen, and click on the "Get local help about Issue Type" button (!https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/ico_help.png!):
|!get-help.png!|
# Look for the resolution previously created

h3. Expected Results
The description of the *Resolution* would be wrapped in the help page.

h3. Actual Results
The text goes off-screen, and there is no side scroll bar to be able to read the text:
|!actual-behavior.png|thumbnail!|
Notice how the words on the end of each line disappear.

h3. Problem Definition
When an issue is created, and *Reporter* is changed to someone other than the creator, any email notifications sent about the issue creation will display the reporter as the creator. You can check the history to verify the true creator of an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user changes the type of directory being used (by editing, not creating a new directory), users will lose their local group memberships 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up an Active Directory LDAP
# Create a Connector directory (Read only with local groups) of type *OpenLDAP* and connect it to Active Directory
# Change all attributes so that it uses AD attributes (eg. sAMAccountname, etc)
# Synchronize users
#* All users should be synced without any problems
# Add some users to locally created groups
# Edit the directory, changing the Directory Type to *Microsoft Active Directory*
# Perform a synchronization

h3. Expected Results
# Nothing is changed

h3. Actual Results
# Users will lose their local group memberships

h3. Notes
# In my test, when changing from {{OpenLDAP > AD}}, *some* users loses their local group memberships, while others maintain theirs
# In my test, when changing from {{AD > OpenLDAP}}, *all* users loses their local group memberships

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Users lose local group memberships when Directory Type is changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Filter's ORDERBY clause is not maintained through REST API

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Manage Filters
# Identify the filterid of any filter which has a column with orderby clause used.
# Access the filter results through REST API

h3. Expected Results
We should get the list of Issues from this filter, and the order of the issue should also be maintained.

h3. Actual Results
The JSON results of the issue filter are not maintained. The JSON is always ordered by *key* descending, regardless of the ORDERBY clause in the filter.
 
h3. Notes
Related to verified bug ticket - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37959

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround, as REST API for JIRA doesn't have an ORDERBY clause for JQL.
fields.summary: A Filter's ORDERBY clause is not maintained through REST API

h3. Summary
When a variable is set to webhooks, it fails to send.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.9
* [RequestBin|http://requestb.in/] to collect requests

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new RequestBin
# Create a new Webhook in JIRA with the RequestBin URL in the previous step
# Check the Issue created, updated and deleted event
!WebHooks.png!
# Create a new issue. Observe the request in RequestBin
# Edit the Wekbook, and add variables. For example: {{http://requestb.in/1ewtovw1/${issue.key}}\}
# Observe the request in RequestBin

h3. Expected Results
Webhooks are submitted for both request (with and without variables)

h3. Actual Results
Only webhooks that has no variables configured are submitted successfully.

The below exception is thrown in the _catalina.out_ file:
{noformat}
2015-08-11 13:19:32,194 httpclient-callbacks:thread-11 WARN anonymous     [atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl$PublishTaskImpl] Client error - 404 when posting to web hook at 'http://putsreq.com/7Bp8mSzIaEQ9w7fY03m2/MI-12'
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an issue is created via email and the email address is not associated to any users in JIRA, the default reporter is used. There will be the following line added to the description of the ticket
{noformat}[Created via e-mail received from: testing jira <test@example.com>]{noformat}

If the username of the default reporter has a capital letter in it, the line above will not be added to the description

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Mail Server and Mail Handler
# Create a user with the username *Admin*
# Set up a Mail Handler specifying *Admin* as the default reporter
# Create an issue via email, making sure that the email used is not associated to any users in JIRA

h3. Expected Results
# The line *\[Created via e-mail received from: testing jira <test@example.com>\]* should be added in the description of the ticket

h3. Actual Results
# Nothing is added to the description of the ticket

h3. Notes
# Tested with *Admin* and *aDmin*
# When the username is *admin*, the line is added as expected

h3.Workaround
# No workaround. Make sure that the username does not contain capital letters
fields.summary: Mail Handler doesn't add "Created via e-mail received from" when default reporter has capital letters in username

fields.description:
h3. Description of problem

Removing a field from the edit screen should prevent the field from being in-line edited. The in-line edit behavior of label-type fields is inconsistent when the field is removed from the edit screen.
 * This behavior has changed between JIRA versions. As of JIRA 7.3.0 the current behavior is incorrect. See Expected Results and Actual Results

h3. Expected Results
 * Behavior is consistent between issue navigator and the view issue screen
 * Fields are not in-line editable if they do not appear on screen associated with edit operation

h3. Actual Results

*As of 7.3*
 The ability to edit Labels fields (Built-in and custom) differs between the issue navigator and the view issue screen.
 * When fields do not appear on edit screen, correct behavior in issue navigator. Incorrect behavior on view issue screen (editable, blue pencil)

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create new project
 # Rename "View/Edit" screen to "View" screen, then copy to create new "Edit" screen
 # Change screen scheme to associate view and edit issue operations with the edit and view screens
 # Create new labels custom field "CFlabel" - Add to view and create screen
 # Check view, create, and edit screens. "Labels" and "CFlabel" should appear on View and Create screens. Remove both fields from the edit screen.
 # Create issues
 ** Issue #1 "No Labels" - Create issue and leave both labels fields empty
 ** Issue #2 "Both Labels" - Create issue and populate both label fields

*Observe:*

*6.4.7*
 * Issue #1
 ** Issue Navigator - *Blue pencil* appears for built in Labels. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty
 ** View Issue - *Blue pencil* appears for built in Labels. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty (Image 1)
 * Issue #2

 ** View Issue - Built in labels field cannot be edited. CFlabel appears and cannot be edited
 *** Image 2 shows 6.4.7 but CFlabel field did not exist. This is why it does not show in the image.

*6.4.12*
 * Issue #1
 ** Issue Navigator - Built in editable, *grey pencil* appears on mouse over. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty
 ** View Issue - Built in editable, *grey pencil* appears on mouse over. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty
 *** One case where the blue icon did show for very brief time when page was loading, this is tracked in JRA-62320
 * Issue #2
 ** Issue Navigator - Built in editable, *grey pencil* appears on mouse over. CFlabel appears and cannot be edited
 ** View Issue - Built in editable, *grey pencil* appears on mouse over. CFlabel appears and cannot be edited

*7.3.0*
 * Issue #1
 ** Issue Navigator - *Blue pencil* appears for built in Labels. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty
 ** View Issue - *Blue pencil* appears for built in Labels. CFlabel does not appear because field is empty
 * Issue #2
 ** Issue Navigator - Built in labels field cannot be edited. CFlabel appears and cannot be edited
 ** View Issue - *Blue pencil* appears for built in Labels. CFlabel appears with *blue pencil*, can be edited

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
Users are unable to assign issues when '_Assign Issues_' and '_Assignable User_' permission are already in place, users are not able to identify the lack of *Browse User* permission when trying to assign issues.
!Screen Shot 2015-08-07 at 2.54.17 PM.png|thumbnail!

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44688].
  {panel}

I have a board with swimlanes based on due date.
1. Due today
duedate <= now()

2. Due next working day
(duedate = endOfDay("+1d") OR (duedate = endOfDay("+2d") AND duedate = startOfWeek("+7d")) OR (duedate = endOfDay("+3d") AND duedate = startOfWeek("+8d")))

For 2, it works as needed, but I'd like to be able to just do "duedate = endOfDay("+1wd") to indicate "plus one working day".  My current setup won't work well for holidays, even though I can add specific days as holidays within JIRA, for example.
fields.summary: Add "working day" to JQL filters

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44680].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary:
When a user specifies an email in the catch email and sends in an email with the specified email in the catch section added into BCC field of the email that is being sent to JIRA.

An issue would not be created, despite the catch email being added to one of the fields mentioned.

{quote}
If specified, only email messages whose To:, Cc:, Bcc: lines contain the recipient specified in this field will be processed — for example, issues@mycompany.com

Upon specifying an address here, all email messages whose To:, Cc:, Bcc: lines contain addresses other than the Catch Email Address are ignored. This is useful if you have multiple aliases for the same mail account (e.g. foo-support@example-co.com and bar-support@example-co.com aliases for support@example-co.com) for multiple mail services (e.g. each one to create issues in separate JIRA projects).

(info) Note: in practice, this option is rarely useful and should not be confused with the more common Default Reporter. You can only specify one catch email address and one issue type per mail handler.
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
- Configuring an incoming mail handler.
- Add in the catch email.
- Create an issue via email adding in the specified catch email to the BCC field.
- Send the email and check if an issue is created.

*Expected Result*
- Issue is created in JIRA

*Actual Result*
- No Issue is created

*Error in Logs*
{noformat}
Cannot handle message.  No recipient addresses found.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issues created via email when catch mail specified in BCC fail to be created

fields.description:
In the official JIRA license documentation (https://developer.atlassian.com/market/add-on-licensing-for-developers/license-validation-rules) it is specified that only evaluation licenses have expiration dates ("A license is invalid if the current date is greater than or equal to the license's expiration date. Normally, only evaluation licenses have expiration dates."), but when we test a non-evaluation timebomb license that has its maintenance period expired, license manager shows that this license has an error (License.Expired error).

-Expected behavior: No license error for non-evaluation license which have expired maintenance
-Actual behavior: There is an License.Expired error thrown returned by API.
fields.summary: Non-Evalution License Expired Problem

A user edited his own profile and made a typo so his email adress was invalid.
This was recognized days later, so e.g. all email notifications during that time could not me sent successfully - they are visible in the mail error queue.
The invalid email adress was fixed, but those emails from the error queue would still be sent to the old invalid email adress insteas of the updated.

It would be great, that emails trying to be resent always use the information from the user profile in case an invalid email adress has been updated, so that those emails are not lost forever.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44651].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When we access to JIRA 6.3.15 and later from IE11, a warning dialog appeared. (Please check the attached image.)
When it comes to a function of attaching a screenshot on IE11, JIRA might not use Java Applet and use functions of HTML5 instead.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Attaching+a+Screenshot]
{panel}
Browser compatibility notes: If you are using Internet Explorer versions 8-10, the computer you are using will need to be running Java version 1.7+ platform. If you are using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer 11, the screenshot capability takes advantage of HTML5 compatibility. Safari is not supported.
{panel}

[https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43266]
{panel}
In IE 9 and then 10 an applet is necessary to provide the attach screenshot functionality. It is expected that the user is prompted to update java if necessary to support this functionality.
{panel}

Therefore, the dialog shouldn't appear anymore.
I've already confirmed this dialog is definitely caused by 'Attach Image for JIRA' add-on.
(When I tried to disable the add-on, this problem didn't appear.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare JIRA 6.3.15 or later
# Install JRE 7 and IE 11 on a client PC (Windows 7)
# Access to the JIRA's login page from the client PC

_Notes: I've already confirm that the same problem didn't happen on JIRA 6.3.0._

h3. Expected Results
The warning dialog like following should never appear on IE11.
{noformat}
This webpage wants to run the following add-on: 'Java SE Runtime Environment 7 Update 80' from 'Oracle America, Inc.'.
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The warning dialog appeared.
fields.summary: IE11 shows warnings about using JAVA even though JIRA 6.3.15 and later doesn't use Java Applet for attaching screenshot anymore

fields.description:
I've seen this a couple of times. Seems to happen often enough when restoring our {{JIRA6.3_QAData.zip}} file.

The database restore will get to the point where it has to shut down and restart the plugin system ( I think ), then start doing that. At that point in time, the UI refreshes and requests some assets that *should* be completely static and not need JIRA to be alive in order to retrieve. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44647].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, executing .bin or .exe installers creates install4j (something like {{i4j_log_JIRA_xxxxxxx.log}}) file in /tmp directory and deletes the log after the process end.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have the ability to add "-debug" option while executing the installers. By this, there will be logs created such as install.log and upgrade.log respectively. 
*Note*: It's even better if we can obtain logs for installation and upgrade by default. :)
fields.summary: The ability to add "-debug" option while executing installers so that respective logs will be created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44645].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA upgrade fails because jira.home value is not specified in {{jira-aplication.properties}} file. The following error will be thrown in the terminal:
{noformat}
[root@xxxx]# ./atlassian-jira-6.4.6-x64.bin
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
Jul 09, 2015 4:51:04 PM java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences$2 run
INFO: Created system preferences directory in java.home.

This will install JIRA 6.4.6 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]
o
Choose the appropriate installation or upgrade option.
Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (use default settings) [1], Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2], Upgrade an existing JIRA installation [3, Enter]
3
Existing installation directory:
[/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira-6.1.7-standalone]

An error occurred when parsing your installation directory. Unfortunately the installer will be unable to continue with the automated upgrade.
Finishing installation ...
[root@xxxx]#
{noformat} 

The jira.home directory is removed from {{jira-aplication.properties}} and defined in the JVM argument {{-Djira.home=/opt/atlassian/jira/home}}.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Have the ability for the installer to look at the JVM argument if jira.home value in {{jira-aplication.properties}} is null. Perhaps, ask user to verify the jira.home value if found in non-default place ({{jira-aplication.properties}}).
# More accurate error to be shown in the terminal instead of {{An error occurred when parsing your installation directory. Unfortunately the installer will be unable to continue with the automated upgrade.}}.
fields.summary: The ability for installer to look at JVM arguments for jira.home value.

fields.description:
It is possible to enumerate usernames through the secure/ViewUserHover resource through the username parameter. JIRA leaks the existence of a username by showing your entire name.
1. Log out of JIRA
2. Go to http(s)://$jira/$contextpath/secure/ViewUserHover!default.jspa?username=$username_of_an_existing_user
2. Note that the username is displayed
3. Go to http(s)://$jira/$contextpath/secure/ViewUserHover!default.jspa?username=$username_of_a_user_that_does_not_exist_in_jira
4. Observe the error message "User does not exist: $username_of_an_existing_user"
fields.summary: Username enumeration through the username parameter to the ViewUserHover resource.

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like for the JIRA 'Create' button to redirect to their Service Desk Customer Portal for issue creation instead of linking to {{https://hostname/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to modify the URL the Create Button links to for creating issues
 
h3. Workaround 
* Login through the Service Desk Customer Portal to create Service Desk 
or
* Use the "Create Service Desk Request" option from the Service Desk top menu.
fields.summary: Change JIRA 'Create' Button URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44641].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is looking for the ability to disable 'Autowatch own Issues' in the User Default Settings based on the user's Group Membership; ie disable auto-watching for specific users

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to Disable 'Autowatch own issues' by Group Membership
 
h3. Workaround 
None, 'Autowatch own issues' is a global setting.  It can either be disabled globally or each user can disable it in their Profile Settings
fields.summary: Disable Autowatch Own Issues by Group Membership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44639].
  {panel}

In the image below, there is a double-ended arrow between *Resolved* and *Waiting for QA*. This image is ambiguous and leaves some room for interpretation.

!2015-08-04 18_55_43-WCS Default Workflow 3.1 - novomind JIRA.png!

# There must be a transition from *Resolved* to *Waiting for QA*. This is because all the vertical lines bend to the left, so the only possible beginning for an arrow is in the *Resolved* box.
# There might be a transition from *Waiting for QA* to *Resolved*. Or there might not. The image doesn’t tell anything about that.
# The vertical lines are connected to *Resolved*, but it is not clear from this part of the image whether they are incoming or outgoing. One would have to follow them to their other end, where the same ambiguities as above could appear.

To solve this ambiguity, incoming and outgoing arrows should never overlap at a box. One way to do that is to have two access points at each edge of a box. All incoming arrows end at the access point that is nearer to the top left corner, and all outgoing arrows end at the access point that is nearer to the bottom right corner. (For RTL-written languages, the top-right and bottom-left corners might be used instead, to follow the natural reading directions.)

!Proposal for arranging the arrows.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: View Workflow Dialog lets arrows enter and leave a state at the same pixel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44638].
  {panel}

I have 350 projects for which I need to migrate the Workflow Scheme, Issue Type Scheme and Issue Type Screen Scheme.

I also need to change the Field Configurations. About 300 of those projects don't even have a Field Configuration Scheme. They use the Default Field Configuration.

For Issue Types, I took me less than an hour since there is an "Associate" operation on the Issue Type Scheme management page. I could set the desired migration parameters and let the tool run the migration in batch.

For the other parameters, It will take me *days* to go through all the clicks! Please do something about this!

I hope this fits well with the scope of issue JRA-3156.
fields.summary: Add an "Associate" operation to Fields, Screens and Workflows

please accept my request
Appointment Booking application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44633].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Project admins are able to configure their Projects Roles and choose groups which they want to be part of a role. They are able to choose the group *jira-users* as well as other groups, some of which are groups which all users in JIRA are members of it. 

Allowing project admins to choose *jira-users* might be useful for some, but for others this might be a big problem especially when they have their Notification Scheme configured to send notifications to entire Project Roles. 

Project Admin unknowingly adds this group to the role causing all users to receive unwanted notifications.

h3. Suggestion
Make it configurable to hide certain groups so that Project Admins will not be able to choose them, or maybe only users with *JIRA System Administrators* permission can choose them.
fields.summary: Hide certain groups when configuring Project Roles

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to [Associating Issue Types with Projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Associating+Issue+Types+with+Projects] :
{quote}
7. Set the *Default Issue Type* for the new scheme from the dropdown list.
* The *Issue Type* is remembered as long as you keep creating issues in the same project. Once you change projects or log off the system, it goes back to the default value.
{quote}

This is true that the issue type will go back to the default value when i logout and login to JIRA again but this is not true if i change project or create an issue from another project. After clicking on another project or creating an issue on another project, when i go back to the affected project, the issue type does not go back to the default value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a default issue type. For this example i will use *Release* as the default issue type. 
!issuet1.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue with another Issue type besides *Release* , for example Task
# Create another issue from another project 
# Go back to or create another issue in the previous project with the issue type *Release*

h3. Expected Results
* The default issue type displayed should be *Release*

h3. Actual Results
* The last selected issue type is displayed (Task)
fields.summary: Default issue type does not reset after changing project
Version report not showing graph

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44630].
  {panel}

h4. PROBLEM:
- Numbers shifted from right to left side alignment in Two Dimensional Filter statistics after upgrading to JIRA 7.1.4

h4. STEPS TO REPRODUCE
* Create a filter
* Add the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics in a dashboard
* Use the filter that was previously created

h4. EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR
In JIRA 6.3.15, all the values are aligned on the right side
!6315.png|thumbnail!


h4. ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR
In JIRA 7.1.4 the alignment shifted to the left instead of being on the right side.

Sea Smile Studio issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44627].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to filter for issues Not fixed in a specific version.

Suppose I've 3 versions : X,Y,Z
And 3 issues :
A, fixed in X
B, fixed in X and Y
C, fixed in Z

I want to get issues fixed in Y or Z, but not in X.
That is, only C. (if I check Y and Z, I'll get B too)

Note the same wish is applicable to every multivalued field.

The "Fixed in" field only allows selection on _positive_ searching (issue _must_ be fixed in version X), it should :
- either allow selection on positive or negative searching (issue _must_ / _mustn't_ be fixed in version X)
- or there should be two entries in field selection : Fixed in version / NOT Fixed in version

EDIT :
I just thought this is possible in advanced JQL, by typing : 
AND fixVersion IN ("Y","Z") AND fixVersion NOT IN ("A")

This is not intuitive (it's like writing "a=1 AND a=2").
fields.summary: Filter on : "NOT fixed in version X"

When hovering on the User Avatar, there are 3 different messages that can be seen. It is quite confusing as there's no official documentation on what is the expected message to see.

* In 6.3.11
!prof_3.jpg|thumbnail!

* In 6.3.15
!prof_2.jpg|thumbnail!

* In 6.4.5
*!prof_1.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Consistency When Hovering on the User Avatar

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44623].
  {panel}

I've installed JIRA 7 to the default path. Then I uninstalled it and tried to install JIRA 6.4.
JIRA couldn't start up, see error: !jira6.4.jpg|thumbnail!

The workaround is
* either before second installation clean up all directories
* or select another installation path for JIRA 6.4
fields.summary: If I uninstall JIRA 7 then further installation of JIRA 6.4 failed

fields.description: It would have been better if JiraLicenseManager and JiraLicenseService had maintained the getLicense() API and just returned the jira-software license details so there would be no change to existing code. This enables the same code to support 6.x and 7.x (without using reflection techniques).
fields.summary: Maintain the getLicense API for JIRA 7.0
